newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani cotton rates hold steady in dull trade.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani cotton rates hold steady in dull trade.

text.p: Pakistani cotton rates closed steady on Wednesday in lacklustre trading as exporters slowed buying, dealers at the private Karachi Cotton Association (KCA) said.
The rates rose in the past few days on buying by exporters who planned to ship cotton before the end of fiscal 1996/97 on June 30, dealer Nasim Usman said.
In the kerb market, the NIAB-78 variety was quoted for 2,000/2,175 rupees per maund (37.32 kg), the K-68 for 2,350/2,400 and the MNH-93 for 2,375/2,400.
